attributes.action: Don't Abolish the House of Lords!
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a great parliamentary asset. Having a body that checks the Commons while being outside of the electoral process prevents rivalry and keeps the system balanced!
attributes.additional_details: If we had an elected Senate in place of the Lords, it would simply rival the Commons. Fundamentally, in elected office, politicians must make promises that pander to voters to keep them elected. The House of Lords doesn't have to fear electoral defeat because they have lifelong tenure and can focus on getting the job done of checking policy! They don't need to be accountable; that's what we have the Commons for whose power is the greatest of the two houses!

attributes.action: Review GB Domestic Driving hours.
attributes.background: 5.5 hours driving with a 30 minute break followed by another 4.5 hours driving is surely a health and safety issue. Bring it inline with EU Driving hours. 4.5 hours driving then a 45 minute break.

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Extend Sunday trading hours
attributes.background: To increase the trading hours to match the other 6 days of the week would increase revenue and employment. Sunday trading laws are out dated and the product of an old fashioned mindset.

attributes.action: Let the public ask for animal abusers to have unduly lenient sentences reviewed.
attributes.background: Animal abuse is currently not one of the crimes for which members of the public can ask for unduly lenient sentences to be reviewed.  This needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Ban TV alcohol advertising completely.
attributes.background:
There are far too many alcohol adverts on TV. Pretty much all of them glamourise alcohol use, making it seem like you'll have a more adventurous life by drinking.

Let's save our people, help alcoholics quit and reduce binge drinking, by banning alcohol advertising on TV completely!
attributes.additional_details:
We all know how much damage alcohol causes. Many thousands of people are hospitalised yearly due to the use (or OVER use) of alcohol.

It is a scourge on our young people, in whom we are now seeing record levels of binge drinking amongst teenagers and people in their early 20s. 

The Beer federation at one point put out a literal "Beer goes with everything" advert. Why is this OK?

NO MORE ENCOURAGEMENT OF DRINKING BY GLAMOURISING IT IN OUR TV ADVERTISING!

attributes.action: Amend class size legislation rule
attributes.background:
We lost our appeal to place our son in the closest school because of class size legislation 
His Dad is disabled and can't walk more than 200 metres and doesn't drive
The new school is 2 miles away so doesn't qualify for assistance there is no bus service or proper pavement
attributes.additional_details:
All relevant Doctors, Stroke Spealist and nuerologist reports were included and ignored His Disability award was provided 
The closet school mentioned it would make sense for our son to be allowed based on Dad's health. The rule was upheld above my child's safety and my husbands disability. 
Fundamentally this rule needs to be changed, forcing a disabled parent to travel further so his child can be educated is unacceptable if he can't get there. My child will walk 4 miles a day he is 5yrs old.

attributes.action: Build a bypass from Sellafield to Barrow in furness
attributes.background: As a very frequent user of the A595 to Barrow in furness like many others I believe the road is inadequate, it is very dangerous and even more so when the weather is bad. Which is extremely often.  I believe that it would be in people's best interest to create a much safer road.
attributes.additional_details:
Teenager airlifted to hospital and man arrested as A595 is closed near Bootle - Sep 2017
A595 blocked by crash - June 2007
Driver to appear in Barrow court after crash on the A595 at Bootle - Sep 2017
These are but a few. I have a whole research file on this. 
There are also many many crashes and closures due to weather. The main causes; snow, ice, rain and fog. People need to use these roads daily. It would be much safer to have a bigger more straight road. Think of the lives that can be saved.

attributes.action: Make the vehicle log book(V5C) proof of ownership
attributes.background: A motor vehicle is usually of high value, easily identified and in the public eye. It is also generally bought and sold several times throughout its lifetime.The UK does not, surprisingly have any 'Ownership Title' document, which is a bit weird when you think about it.
attributes.additional_details:
The DVLA, Government, Police, Finance Companies etc., all have their own reasons and all of them can explain the current form of V5C but it does not help and it does not matter.
 What matters and is very important is your opinion. You, the reader, can change something for the better. Here, now! Think about you and others. Make it simple, easy and clear. Protect yourself against problems! Protect yourself from crooks and criminals, scammers and thieves! 
 If you want an ownership title for your vehicle/motor then please, please sign this petition! Make your opinion count! Make the V5C proof of ownership!
Thank you

attributes.action: Select members of the BBC board in the same way that juries are chosen
attributes.background: We believe that the BBC should be unbiased. There have been many accusations recently that there is right wing bias. In the past there have been accusation of left wing bias. At present government ministers decide who is appointed to the BBC board. This gives rise to conflicts of interest.

attributes.action: Scrap the drivers CPC
attributes.background: Now we are leaving the European Union we should scrap the drivers CPC as it stops people getting back into driving jobs unless they complete this pointless course that can be about anything from healthy eating to general health and safety also a waste of my time and money.

attributes.action: To be made law that all public buildings in the UK to fly the Union Flag
attributes.background: Many countries around the world take pride in their national flag it seems the that UK is almost afraid to fly its flag for the fear of upsetting someone. After BREXIT we will once again be an independent country and should fly our flag as often and conspicuously as possible on all public buildings

attributes.action: Add directly democratic measures to the political process of the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Pure representative democracy offers only the power to select humans for office, not the right to influence policy. Whilst protest is available to voice policy concerns, it is not a direct solution, and often not heeded. Some access to direct democracy would offer a check to representative action.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonably evident, after a century of representative democracy, that the process is flawed. Representatives are often elected on overly optimistic statements, false promises, even lies. Once in power, the judicial branch is often too slow to provide a check or balance for representative actions. 

Putting a Swiss style democratic system in place - where the electorate can, through petition, gain access to referendum, would offer a timely check on laws passed by representatives.

attributes.action: Impose checks on companies reporting gender pay gap figures
attributes.background: The Financial Times recently reported that some companies who have submitted data on the gender pay gap within their organisations have produced ‘highly improbable’ figures. The government must set up a task force to investigate them and impose fines on companies who have filed inaccurate data.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/ad74ba76-d9cb-11e7-a039-c64b1c09b482

15 organisations so far have declared that they have no pay gap. The FT reported that it was 'highly anomalous' for those companies to report no gap. Since the FT scrutinised the figures of Hugo Boss, who initially reported zero pay gap, they have amended their submission to a mean gender pay gap of 32.6%. The law was introduced to prevent organisations from hiding their gender pay gaps. Let’s not allow them to  report false data.

attributes.action: Make local councils install CCTV outside schools to reduce the risk of accidents
attributes.background:
We all see lazy parents dropping their children off at school. 

This petition is to ask the government to make it compulsory for local councils to install cctv outside schools to catch and fine drivers who ignore road safety. In an attempt to persuade lazy drivers not to park on zig zag markings.

attributes.action: Provide free broadband to every UK home
attributes.background: Broadband is a necessity in today's world and should therefore be accessible to all, much like fresh running water and electricity. Surely if every house was provided with broadband through a nationalised BT Openreach, it would be more cost effective than each person arranging their own.
attributes.additional_details: The infrastructure already exists to provide every home in the UK with free broadband and would not be an expensive project. BT Openreach have an undeserved monopoly in this market and should be nationalised to provide this public service. The minimal cost could be added to our council tax bills and would be a lot less than most homes currently pay for broadband. Like most public services those less able to pay, would pay less through means tested lower council tax bills but all would benefit

attributes.action: Abolish taxation on voluntary tips for good service.
attributes.background: A tip is a voluntary gift from a person being served to a server and as such should be given tax exempt status. As many people who rely on tips are students, in between jobs or in low income families this would help ease ever increasing money burdens and possibly even stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: Stop penalising long-term partners at 40% when it comes to Inheritance Tax
attributes.background: We believe, in terms of Inheritance Tax, long-term partners are being treated grossly unfairly as opposed to married couples/civil partners.  Like millions of others in this country, long-term partners are equally committed to each other as anyone else and should not be penalised with a 40% tax!
attributes.additional_details: Some12,000,000 people in this country for many personal reasons choose not to marry.  In some cases a previous bad experience in marriage may persuade them not to say "I do" for a second time. Previous correspondence from the Treasury suggested that married couples/civil partners were seen as being in "committed/recognised" relationships.  This is something of an insult to genuine couples who have been together but unmarried for 25+ years. The government must stop this totally unfair prejudice.

attributes.action: All Mainstream Schools should have the resources to teach deaf children.
attributes.background: Pupils with special needs have a basic right to a mainstream education and the increased opportunity for social interaction with their peers that this brings. Mainstream participation allows everybody the opportunity to learn to understand the diversity of human ability, without prejudice.
attributes.additional_details:
In Manchester there are currently only 2 schools with the resource to teach deaf children. Both in the same area of Manchester, so the council pay to transport children from all over Manchester to these 2 schools. To clarify 'resource' is a room where a teacher for the deaf can do some quiet work with the deaf children. 
There are new schools being built all the time, surely this is a perfect opportunity to add the resource bases the schools need. The deaf teachers are already here and trained.

attributes.action: The environment to be taught as a compulsory subject throughout school life.
attributes.background: All the good we do now with regards to litter picking, recycling, and on environmental issues will be a complete waste of time if we do not start to educate everyone from the year dot. We need to stop the rot so that our future generations will make a better job of looking after our world.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the people reading this will never have known what it is like to be brought up in a clean and pristine country. If we want to change this for our future generations we have to start NOW, and as with everything in life it begins with education. Many children are shown and taught to do the right thing before they start school, sadly many more are not because their parents themselves were not taught. We urgently need to stop this repetitive cycle which is why l have started this petition.

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Amend Highway Code to include guidance for pothole avoidance
attributes.background: With the increasing number of unmarked dangerous defects in our road surfaces nationwide, there is no guidance in the Highway Code regarding a safe approach. Does one brake sharply, swerve, or proceed over the defect rendering your vehicle or motorcycle uncontrollable and potentially damaged?

attributes.action: Standardizing the work week to 4 days with a 3 day weekend.
attributes.background:
Increased productivity for business (studies show that employees working a four-day work week are more productive and happier overall); 
Cutting child care issues and costs, health problems from work related stress and an overall healthier work life balance.

attributes.action: Protect property sellers by introducing 'conclusion of missives' contracts
attributes.background: In Scotland you cannot back out of a house sale once 'missives are concluded', yet this is not the same in England. This will raise confidence for sellers and save any last minute dissapointments which costs the seller time, money, uncertainty and stress.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently I have had a buyer pull out of our sale 2 weeks before completion which, unless i can find a new buyer quickly, means we will lose the house we planned to buy, our deposit and all of the upfront fees we paid coming to almost £2000.
A lot of people have been in the same situation costing families thousands of pounds that they cannot afford to lose. If we introduce laws such as Scotlands, home sellers have more protection against buyers pulling out at the last minute with no repercussions

attributes.action: Lower the driving age to 15
attributes.background: Many students have to walk to school due to their families working or broken families. Result? many students get involved in alleyway gangs some can then skip school. If these students were allowed to drive they wouldn't get involved in drugs, but instead they wud be able to get to school and learn.

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: Change the criteria for PIP assessments
attributes.background: Many disabled have been taken off their benefits despite no improvement to their condition. The PIP criteria does not adequately assess the effects of disability and is far too severe. It should be changed under the advice of doctors and disabled people.
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the disability part of working tax credits you must receive PIP, but nowhere in PIP is your ability to work assessed. The PIP assessment is unconcerned with your quality of life and tries to fit disabled people into narrow tick boxes which often aren’t appropriate. Many feel that the PIP assessment is poorly suited to its purpose. The general public, disabled in particular, should be consulted and in partnership with doctors, a new system drawn up.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to smoke inside private homes where children live
attributes.background: Parliament should extend the smoke-free workplace legislation to include private homes where children reside, provide for deterrent sentences upon conviction and a fixed penalty scheme, raise awareness via the school curriculum and provide a helpline for children to report offenders.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free of charge in the UK for people diagnosed with IBD
attributes.background: IBD is one of the only chronic illnesses where sufferers have to pay for prescriptions. More often than not they will need medication for life. It is unfair that they have to pay for it when other chronic illnesses are recognised for the purpose of free of charge prescriptions.

attributes.action: A final referendum on EU membership at the same time as a General Election.
attributes.background:
Once this Government has completed their negotiations with the EU27, they should resign and a General Election be called before implementing our departure from the EU.

At the same time a binding referendum on EU membership be held and the subsequent Parliament be obliged to implement the result.
attributes.additional_details: This would ensure a proper debate on the issues, with the electorate clear about the consequences of their votes.  There would be no reason to object to the result with all the facts known and new Parliament elected fully aware of its obligations.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to choose the colour of their own passport.
attributes.background: This petition would permit each individual citizen to choose their own passport colour, which should be possible regardless of the eventual outcome of Brexit. Contrary to popular opinion, the EU does NOT mandate the passport colour of its member states.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory maximum speed limiters on all vehicles driven on UK roads.
attributes.background: Most production cars & motorcycles manufactured today are capable of speeds well in excess of 70 mph with some high performance models able to reach up to 155mph.
attributes.additional_details: Criminals ignore speed limits and we regularly see news reports of police pursuing stolen high performance cars in excess of 100mph with some causing deaths and injuries. It is illegal to drive above the speed limit. Why are cars that can travel over the maximum legal speed limit allowed on our roads? The new range of Ford Fiestas have maximum speeds of between 99 and 121mph (Autocar). I am calling for compulsory top speed  limiters to be fitted to all vehicles used on UK roads to save lives.

attributes.action: The undersigned ask for the following to b implemented to End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a Housing Crisis and something desperately needs to be done , such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
GIVE Bursaries/reduce restrictions on Brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies;This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

THAT each development Must have a specified % of Council, Affordable, Single-living & Various bedroom houses avaliable, so to meet the needs of all the community. 

A LAW that after a developer has received planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build, to stop Land Banking.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into why the UK issued new, lower alcohol guidelines
attributes.background: It appears that the Guidelines Development Group responsible for the new 2016 alcohol intake guidelines contained a large number of people from temperance groups. This suggests that science could have been manipulated to support an anti-alcohol agenda, rather than produce evidence-based guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government should set up a public inquiry to examine the research and how the new guidelines were produced.

attributes.action: Abolish PIP assessments in England
attributes.background: Disabled people will not have to go through "unnecessary" medical checks to claim benefits under Scotland's new social security system, according to the minister in charge. Disabled people should have equal rights in England. PIP assessments should be abolished.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: Create a government virtual address for homeless people to use as fixed abode.
attributes.background: Homeless people are prevented from progressing with services and employment opportunities due to no fixed address.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy concerning box junctions.
attributes.background: If you stop in a box junction you are breaking the law and will receive a fine. There should be advance road sign warnings, and visual help to indicate how much space is after the junction. Drivers should be given more leniency if a vehicle enters the junction by 2 meters.

attributes.action: Urge the FA to withdraw the England team from the World Cup this summer.
attributes.background: The chemical attack on the streets of Salisbury is little short of a declaration of war on Britain's right to offer safe haven to whomsoever it chooses.  Our response must be much bolder than it has so far been.  Putin must not be allowed to use the world cup to normalise his tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: This petition seeks a debate in Parliament whose aim is to persuade the government to urge the FA to withdraw the England Football Team from the World Cup in Russia this summer and to discuss with others who have qualifying teams the possibility of doing the same.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Reinstate Part 2 of the Leveson Inquiry
attributes.background: The Government has cancelled the second part of the Leveson Inquiry into the scale of potentially unlawful behaviour by the Press and Police during the phone hacking scandal.
attributes.additional_details: The public deserves to know of any collaboration involved and any identified offenders should be brought to justice.

attributes.action: Give parents paid leave for school closure/sickness for their children
attributes.background: I find it ever so unfair when you work hard to support your children, children are far more likely to pick up bugs and illnesses, parent should not have to lose pay or take holiday to cover the time off to look their child it should paid by the employer
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was recently admitted into hospital, she was there for a week, I had to take it as holiday because i would lose a lot of money if I took it as sick.... firstly I’m not sick and secondly it’s not a holiday, I should be entitled to get paid time off for my child care, but it must be proven time off obviously, I however took it as holiday as I had no choice, this I feel is unfair as you should no be punished for a child sickness, I would work if I was ill, but children are different

attributes.action: Make 11/11/2018 a non-trading day in remembrance of the First World War
attributes.background: There have been global commemorations to acknowledge the debt owed by all of us to all those affected by the terrible events of World War One. The Centenary of the ending of WW1 falls on Sunday 11/11/18. there can be a no better way to show our respect by ceasing all trading on that day.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on America until they change their laws regarding firearms
attributes.background: Since the start of 2018, 18 school shootings have occurred in the USA - averaging to three every week. This is as much a gun control issue as it is a mental health issue. We call upon the government to impose some sanctions upon the US until they DO something to control this devastating situation.

attributes.action: Abolish section 58 highways act 1980
attributes.background: I dont think local councils should be able to use this act as a get out clause for not maintaining the roads to a higher standard.
attributes.additional_details: The roads are in a terrible state all over the country but councils are getting out of paying for the damage to all modes of transport on the roads due to this section 58 act. If they are unaware of the pot hole they cant fix it so its not their fault, thats great but if we let a payment slip or the likes of car insurance lapse we cant just say I never knew about it and be let off. Ignorance is not an excuse for us and should be the same for them do more thorough checks and sort out the roads.

attributes.action: Rule out involving our NHS in a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: Theresa May has refused to rule out trading away our NHS in a deal with the USA. We want to show that that is not the will of the people.

attributes.action: Ban homework for Year 11 students a few months before the GCSE exams
attributes.background: I think that homework should be banned because it gives us little time to revise. It takes up most of our time at home that we have after school, and leaves us with only maybe 1 hour to revise after the homework. One hour a day is not enough for GCSE students.

attributes.action: Make plastic packaging show images of the damage they cause to the environment
attributes.background: Putting images or warnings about the damage caused to our environment, particularly marine life, by single use plastic bags and packaging will deter people from buying these items and push large producers of such items to use biodegradable alternatives. We cannot let nature suffer our waste anymore.
attributes.additional_details: Walking through supermarkets we often pick things up for their convenience without giving a second thought to what happens to the packaging once we’re done with it. Recently however, we have seen shocking footage of marine life facing the consequences of human waste such as a mother whale not wanting to leave behind her dead calf, poisoned by plastics. This cannot go on. Seeing the devastation caused as you’re about to pick up something wrapped in plastic might make you think twice about it.

attributes.action: Use all National Lottery profits to help fund National Health Service
attributes.background: It is clear that our NHS is overstretched and desperately requires additional funding. There is, in my opinion, no more worthy a cause for National Lottery money to be spent on. It is my belief that tens of thousands additional tickets would be purchased for this cause.
attributes.additional_details: Having put this idea to many people over recent months the general consensus is that most people, like me, would be happy to invest £10 per week if we knew the money was going to the NHS.

attributes.action: Investigate the risk to health from formaldehyde insulation in 1m older UK homes
attributes.background: As a social housing tenant in a former council owned property, now managed by a housing trust, I only discovered that it's cavity wall insulation contains formaldehyde (a known carcinogenic) when contractors negligently blew this noxious powder into my home & exposed us to its ongoing health risks!
attributes.additional_details:
Upon exposure to this atomised irritant, it was blasted into my home under 3,000 psi of machine fed pressure, I initially suffered a severe burning sensation in my eyes, nose, throat & chest, which continued to cause much discomfort for approx. 6 weeks afterwards; some of my neighbours were similarly affected.

On researching the topic I've discovered up to 1m older UK homes may be at risk of this hidden toxin & the EU's listed this substance as a contributory factor to leukemia & nasal cancer.
